docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, May 10 -The United States is now prepared to consider financial aid to foreign Government-owned oil companies, including state monopolies, to help supply equipment.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 10 -The United States is now prepared to consider financial aid to foreign Government-owned oil companies, including state monopolies, to help supply equipment.
docs.abstract: US Export-Import Bank drops ban on aid to foreign Govt-owned cos, including state monopolies, to buy equipment

headline.main: U.S. EASES POLICY FOR LATIN OIL AID; Drops Ban on Financial Help for State Monopolies -Bolivia Request Studied U.S. Eases Policy; May Help Latins Develop State Oil

byline.original: By TAD SZULC Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: The following quotations are selling prices in United States dollars and cents for free market banknote transactions at New York. These rates do not apply to regular foreign exchange business transacted by banks.

docs.snippet: Helen Hayes has extended her stay with the Theatre Guild American Repertory Company to cover a three-month tour of Latin America. Sixteen cities in ten countries will be visited, probably starting Aug. 13 in Caracas, Venezuela.
docs.lead_paragraph: Helen Hayes has extended her stay with the Theatre Guild American Repertory Company to cover a three-month tour of Latin America. Sixteen cities in ten countries will be visited, probably starting Aug. 13 in Caracas, Venezuela.
docs.abstract: 3-mo tour of Latin Amer set; Hayes to remain

headline.main: HELEN HAYES STAYS ON; Extends Theatre Guild Stint to Cover Latin America

docs.snippet: Foreign exchange market was uneventful during the past week. British pound sterling and Canadian dollar maintained a steady undertone in fairly active dealings.

docs.snippet: PARIS, May 18 (AP) -- Ron Holmberg of Brooklyn advanced to the fourth round of the French tennis tournament today, along with Nicola Pietrangeli of Italy and Rod Laver of Australia.
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, May 18 (AP) -- Ron Holmberg of Brooklyn advanced to the fourth round of the French tennis tournament today, along with Nicola Pietrangeli of Italy and Rod Laver of Australia.

headline.main: Holmberg Puts Out Lachen in Tennis; BROOKLYN PLAYER WINS 4-SET MATCH Holmberg, Pietrangeli and Laver Gain Fourth Round in Paris Tournament

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, May 18 -- President Kennedy is planning to send Adlai E. Stevenson on a goodwill tour of Latin America next month.

docs.snippet: An evening of entertainment, highlighted by celebrities from widely varying backgrounds, will be held on Friday in the Hunter College Auditorium. Proceeds will benefit the scholarship fund of the United Nations International School.
